intro: Kuepferia sichitoensis, commonly known as the East African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of East Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at elevations between 1,500 and 3,000 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered with fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branched. Kuepferia sichitoensis is often found in open grasslands and is adapted to the region's cool, temperate climate.
